comment: Looks and feels great.

title: Since jaunty distro +ilovethis
comment: Notes is awesome

title: Great
comment: It's great to have a fully open-source alternative for note-taking apps like evernote, with syncing capability.  It could use a few additions such as support for notebooks like on the desktop client but it's great to have this much already.
Awesome
I could not get it to sync with OneOffice

title: Unable to view/edit rich format text
comment: I tried the latest version 0.7.5 on both my S3 phone and Note 8 tablet but neither can allow me to edit or view the note text with formatting as shown in the screenshots above. Please help me make it work. Thanks.

title: More Formatting Features Needed for Real Note Taking
comment: There is some basic on/off formatting which makes it better than plain notepad apps, but you can't indent, and although the official screen shots mentioned something about nested notes, I couldn't find that on the formatting bar (on the phone where I would be taking these notes).

title: Comes closes
comment: One of the only good lightweight Rich Text Editor

title: Works awesome
comment: Wow. Got it going in less than 5 minutes. Using with btsync rather than a server. This is just incredible. Thank-you!  My only wish would be to use the notebook feature. But really that is so trivial compared to instead awesome secure private note sync with almost no effort!
Yay!  Hugely useful!  Less hype and glitz better service.   Deserves every star.

title: Nice app but little disappointed
comment: Creates notes well. But syncs from its single folder. So when syncing it reads notes but not notebooks. That makes it incomplete as the main purpose is using it with Tomboy notes from Linux. Please make this happen :) Update: as reported in launchpad this will be a feature in the next 0.8 release.

title: Getting much better - keep it up!
comment: As a longtime user of tomboy on Linux I need to have easy access on my Nexus Tablet. This now almost does it all. Congratulations. Synching still is not totally intuitive yet but getting better all the time with each new release.

title: Worthy Attempt
comment: Not very usable without feasible sync and notebook support.  rainy server is not something the avg user can install. As is, presents a random list of notes.  Good as a stand alone basic  note app or to read a limited number of notes from tomboy

title: Good start
comment: Is a bit confusing, eg how do you create lists, or links? Am not really interested in syncing to servers or desktops, so am looking at this as a local text editor, and as such it is ok, but no more than that.

title: Nice work!
comment: Thanks for your effort to bring this life.  Been looking forward to this for a while.

title: Nice app but where's the dropbox and google drive support?
comment: Would be really nice if tomboy/tomdroid/gnotes etc would support syncing to common online storage. this is what would help the apps really fly.
Best app for notes

title: Complete solution for notes
comment: Running this with Snowy synchronization server, web interface and Tomboy Notes on multiple Ubuntu and Windows desktops.

title: Almost useless
comment: Since this is read only and since you can no longer sync it over the network, it's not much use for anything. Apparently you can install a beta with edit enabled from Launchpad, which would be an improvement, but it's still not very easy to use without network sync.

title: A good start
comment: While this version is very limited in its usefulness, there is a newer version released that supports editing. You can download the package from the official Launchpad site. You'll need to enable installing apps from unknown sources.

title: Sweet

title: Some unexpected behavior
comment: Works almost as advertised, except for one thing: when clicking on links to notes with titles that look like urls, this software goes to the url on the browser instead of going to the proper note. On the ubuntu desktop, tomboy goes to the note.
Its cool
Love it

title: Handy App
comment: Does exactly as described, and have no complaints. Has not been updated since October 2010 though.

title: Good
comment: Still waiting for the ability to edit and delete notes

title: Alternative app
comment: This app is very good, but for many of those who are missing the ability to edit your notes on your android device and sync back to UbuntuOne and Tomboy Notes, there is an alternative which I had just found out about. Try Chalk Notes Beta app. I guess it lacks the ability to use links and some formatting but works for me perfectly for adding a simple note and editing your current ones. Sync with Tomboy on your linux machine works perfectly. Seemed like a great alterantive while Tomdroid is still in read-only mode.
Awesome but hanging out for edit option in Android

title: Does the job
comment: I'm ok with the fact that it's read only to reduce the complexity of parallel editing.  I'm sure this would also reduce battery usage of constantly polling and pushing data changes.
